intro: Chondropetalum rectum, commonly known as the straight-stemmed clubmoss, is a member of the Lycopodiaceae family. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with upright, segmented stems and small, scale-like leaves. It produces spores in cone-like structures called strobili, which are located at the tips of the branches. Chondropetalum rectum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
